View.js

Contains the View class.

View

Abstract interface class. Separates the interface into background, objects and grippers which concrete implementations of this view might want to draw separately to improve the performance (the components are static to varying degrees).  While drawing functions lack implementations, internal data structures and basic communication with the model are already sketched out in this class.

Functions
Constructor
constructor(
modelSocket
)

Initializes socket listeners.

Params
modelSocket

Socket io connection to the server

Properties
canvasWidth

canvas width in pixels

canvasHeight

canvas height in pixels

blockSize

size of a (square) block in pixels

Functions
clear
clear()

Remove any old drawings.

draw
draw()

Draw background, objects, grippers.

redraw
redraw()

Redraw everything.  In contrast to draw, this function assumes the game has been drawn in the past and the old drawing needs to be removed first.

drawBg
drawBg()

Draw a background to the game.  Stub.

redrawBg
redrawBg()

Redraw the background.  In contrast to drawBg, this function assumes the background has been drawn in the past and the old drawing needs to be removed first.

drawObjs
drawObjs()

Draw the (static) objects.  Stub.

redrawObjs
redrawObjs()

Redraw the (static) objects.  In contrast to drawObjs, this function assumes the objects have been drawn in the past and the old drawing needs to be removed first.  Stub.

drawGr
drawGr()

Draw the Gripper (and, depending on the implementation, the gripped Obj too).

redrawGr
redrawGr()

Draw the Gripper (and, depending on the implementation, the gripped Obj too).  In contrast to drawGr, this function assumes the gripper has been drawn in the past and the old drawing needs to be removed first.
